item.description:
From the Publisher:

The Grouchy Ladybug Game brings the Eric Carle book alive with a whale of a game board complete with a moving whale tail. Children move their ladybugs through the game, practicing manners, meeting animal friends and gathering a nice meal!

Each player starts with a grouchy, hungry ladybug and an empty leaf. Players move around the board finding food for their hungry ladybugs. In this game, it takes a polite "please" to move ahead and feed a ladybug. When players land on a ladybug space, they choose an animal card and explore the relative size of various animals.

Contents include a giant game board with moving whale tail, 4 ladybug game pieces, 12 animal cards, 50 aphid (bug) tokens, spinner & instructions. For 2 to 4 players. Ages 3 and up

In Mow 'Em Down, players represent different landscape company owners who bid to win landscaping contracts throughout an ever-growing city. Players can bid only if they have enough lawn mowers available in their company. As players win contracts, they earn money to purchase more lawn mowers, which allows them to bid on future contracts. Contracts can expire, so players must be savvy with their bids to maintain a profitable business.

During one's turn, a player receives earnings from previously won contracts and purchases new equipment if desired. Then the player roles the die to determine which of three sizes of land tiles to act upon for the duration of the turn. Once the size of land tile has been determined by the die, the player chooses from one of three actions to take: BUILD, BID, or BOOT.

If the player chooses BUILD, the player expands the city by drawing and placing a new land tile of the determined size to the existing city.

If the player chooses BID, the player opens an auction on one or two land tiles of the determined size for eligible players to bid on contracts. (In most cases, the lowest bidders win the contracts.) The winning players will receive these earnings on future turns.

If the player chooses BOOT, the player cancels and removes a contract of the determined size and the affected player will not continue to receive these earnings on future turns.

Various bonuses and event cards can be earned or played throughout the game that add some random elements.

The game ends when the last land tile is placed onto the city and all other players take one additional turn. The player with the highest total value, including cash, earnings and equipment is declared the winner.

Home Page: http://www.mowemdown.com

item.description: Bone-Didley is an exciting game involving both skill and luck. As long as you keep scoring you can keep rolling...But, you risk it all with each new roll! So, have fun but don't get caught with Bone-Didley!!

Showtime Hanoi is the third game in the Pocket Battle Games series from LPS, Inc.

Cunningham and Driscoll vs. Colonel Tomb, 1972.

Showtime Hanoi is a mini-game complete with map, rules and counters. No need for dice, use your own deck of standard playing cards and your initiative to enjoy this simple-but-exciting game.

Players control up to three planes each in this NV vs. US Dogfight. NV side consists of Mig17, Mig19, Mig21 and 3 AAA. US player controls 2 F4s and an A4.

US objective is to bomb a central target or destroy any of the NV aircraft while losing no US aircraft. NV wins if the target is still on the map or he destroys more than one US aircraft. Map is 8x8 grid.

In Spellbinder the aim of the game is to create and collect as many words as possible.

Tiles are distributed, face down to all players. Each player then takes turns to turn over a tile and place it in the playing area. The players all must try to be the first to call out a word of 3 or more letters from the face up tiles in the play area.

There are also variations of play, explained in the rules.

Game contects: 100 tiles including 2 blanks

From the box:
"These highly successful and irresistibly cuddly dogs have captured the hearts and affections of thousands of children and adults with their doleful expressions, floppy ears and huggable qualities.
Shaped to be hugged, the Pound Puppies' motto says simply:
"All I need is love".
Join these lovable bundles of fun in this simple card game where the winner is the player who has collected all the cards at the end of the game."

Game contains 40 giant sized play cards and rules.
For Ages 5 - 11.

A simple game of trick taking.

item.description:
Germania broadly represents the situation in western Europe following the fall of the Roman Empire. Each of two to five players represents one of the Germanic invaders who, pushed by the Asiatic Huns, settled in and eventually destroyed Rome. As they attempt to consolidate and expand their holdings, a variety of invading nations threaten to overwhelm them, as they overwhelmed Rome. The game combines “Euro” elements with a light historical wargame. The game uses no dice; players use cards to influence combat, and also use event cards to control non-Germanic invaders and influence other players. Scoring occurs each century, with the last century counting much more than others.

In some ways this is a game of survival, of maintaining a civilization. It is possible to win without directly attacking other players, though successful players usually directly attack another player at some point in the game.

Players take turns executing a variety of Actions up to a limit of six Action Points. Some of the Actions are creating new settlers, moving pieces, and playing Event Cards. Three or (in Standard and Advanced games) four rounds of turns are a century. Invasions occur at the end of each Century, or they may occur because of an Event Card played by a player. One player or another temporarily controls Invaders as they invade. Players attempt to increase the number of settled areas, improve those areas, and, in Standard and Advanced games, build cities. They will probably fight Invaders, and may fight one another, using Battle Cards to help resolve these fights.

item.description:
Space Race 2000 was developed after 2 1/2 years research and testing by its Seattle, Washington inventor. The game provides basic planet information such as names of all the planets, how many planets are there? Which planet is closest to the earth? Many other questions are answered as you never lose interest in the excitement of the game. Excellent learning tool for all ages as our progress in space continues. (Not a trivia game)"

Roll-and-move around the ring-shaped board attempting to land on every planet of the solar system. Collect all 8 planet chips plus one moon chip and then return to Earth to win.

Christian game with the appearance of Monopoly, but players are not required to purchase properties to acquire riches. Instead, merely landing on a square results in the blessing of generosity. Spaces for answering Bible trivia questions are included for good measure.

Each Anno Domini set consists of 336 cards, with a description of a historical event on one side of the card, and the year (and sometimes specific date) in which it happened on the other.

Each player receives nine of these cards (or less, if you want the game to be shorter), and may only look at the descriptions. Players then put in turn a card on the table, *trying* to put theirs in chronological order. A player may, instead of adding a card, claim that the order in which the cards were put is incorrect. In this case all cards are turned over and the correct years revealed.
If the order was correct then the doubting player receives two cards and skips a turn. If the order was incorrect then the previous player, who accepted the order as correct, receives three cards. The first player that gets rid of all the cards wins.

Bluffing is as least as important as knowledge in this game. Most events are rather obscure or are hard to date exactly, so this ain’t no game for the nerds/geeks of this world, even they might think so, because it’s full of surprises and pure fun. Highly recommended, because Anno Domini is a blast to play, is a very enjoyable social event and you even learn something from it.

Unfortunately there is no English edition in existence, but this game could be a good way, to improve your already existing German skills or a very good reason, to learn German language in the first place.

The set "Wort Schrift Buch" contains historical events which are related to writing and printing, and to the history of popular phrases. Like all Anno Domini the "Wort Schrift Buch" edition can be played as standalone or mixed with some or even all editions.

Part of the Anno Domini series

item.description:
The players are pickpockets in a bar. The aim of the game is to leave the bar as rich as possible.

A round starts by turning a card. On this card you see a number of lines (maximum 4). The players have to decide to leave the bar with the current earnings or to turn a new card. When they turn a card there is a risk of being thrown out of the bar if all the lines on the cards are broken. As long as there is one line that starts on the first card and ends on the last card without any interruptions in between they can stay in the bar to continue stealing.

You can also turn a card that shows a guard. As soon as two guards are turned the exits of the bar are blocked. In this way it is impossible to leave the bar. There are also a few other cards available to add some variation to the game.

The game is played in several rounds. Each round you have to decide how much risk you are willing to take. Timing and luck are very important.

item.description:
User review: One player acts a gamemaster for two to four other players. In most editions there are five categories. Each catagory has five dollar amounts. Behind each dollar amount is a statement of trivia having to do with the category. When a player thinks he or she knows the correect response to a statement, that person signals and responds in the form of a question. A player is rewarded with the amount associated with the statement if correct, and penalized the corresponding amount if incorrect.

When the board is cleared, the process is repeated for "Double Jeopardy" with five new categories and double the stakes.

One statement in the first round and two statements in the second round are designated as "Daily Double." Only the person who chose the statement may bet any or all of his or her winnings on giving the correct response. Unlike most other editions, the Daily Doubles have been chosen by the publisher.

One of the highest valued statements in a category has been saved for the last round, "Final Jeopardy." In this phase, the players secretly bet any or all of their winnings and record their responses.

The player with the most amount of money at the end of the game is the winner.

Black & Tan War is an historical simulation of the Irish War of Independence, 1919-1921. Each player has a unique deck of cards that “drives” nearly all game procedures.

MAP: Map depicts all of Ireland divided into 16 different regions (plus Dublin)

SCALE: Operational. Turns are bi-monthly. Irish units represent 12-100 men. British units are army battalions, auxiliary police companies, and local constabulary.

COMPONENTS: Two decks of 55 cards each, 22” x 34” map, 280 ½” counters, 77 5/8” counters, 24 page rulebook, and 3 player aid cards.

COMPLEXITY: Medium. Somewhere between We the People and Wilderness War.

One player controls the forces of the British Crown – regular battalions of the Royal Army, the Royal Irish Constabulary (RIC), its elite Auxiliary Division, and the English “Black & Tans” who filled the RIC’s vacant ranks as native Irish policemen resigned from the force.

Each card in the Crown Player’s deck may be played for 5 different purposes:

1) To conduct Operations with a number of units determined by the card’s value. These can be Patrols that aim to “show the flag” and catch the foe unawares; small-scale Raids to capture known or suspected Republican activists; and large-scale military Roundups intended to encircle and trap guerrilla units.

2) To cause an Event, of which there are many different types, including: Army Reinforcements, Blockade, Spies, Black & Tans, Motorization, Armored Cars, Mass Arrests, the RAF, and various new laws – just to name a few.

3) To recruit an Informer in one of the three regions listed on the card. These greatly boost the effectiveness of local Crown operations – and impede the activities of Republican guerrillas.

Crown forces other than the Irish-born RIC may take revenge for guerrilla attacks and the generally hostile attitude of the natives by destroying civilian property. Such ‘reprisals’ can play a significant role in eroding both the British and Irish peoples’ will to continue the struggle.

item.description:
Be the first to reach FINISH after progressing along the path marking the history and evolution of the Bell System.

Includes a colorful board, four plastic telephone tokens, two special "Touch Tone" dice, and storage insert.

Telephone Pioneers of America

(c)1982 Cadaco

The little frogs are jumping around the pond. Both dice are used: First your frog is moved according to the dots on the die. It jumps toward the right or left. If it lands on a mound of earth, it can jump forwards toward the pond! Then, the stork is moved using the colored die, stalking in a clockwise direction around the ring of flowers. Watch out! If there is a frog in the same segment of the circle as the stork, the frog is frightened into jumping away from the pond! The winner is the player first able to snatch two flies from the pond.

This generic baseball game (apparently designed for the Little League set) uses special dice to simulate a baseball game. Roll for the pitch, roll for the batter. Advanced rules allow for other special dice to simulate various situations, such as bunts and stealing. Game comes with board, pawns, score pad, and special dice.

[from Product Description]

What About Baseball - A Realistic Baseball Board Game That Gives You the Feel of Real Baseball. Recommended for Ages 8 Years and Older. Fun for the Entire Family - Boys, Girls and Grown-Ups, too. A Combination of Strategy and Chance. Fast-Paced, Easy-to-Learn Baseball Action. Game Includes Playing Pieces, Baseball Diamond Playing Board, Score Sheets and Special Batting and Pitching Dice for Realistic Action. Make Your Own Teams, Pitch a Shut-Out, Throw a Runner Out or Hit a Grand Slam! The Most Realistic, Old-Fashioned Baseball Board Game Ever Created! Fun for the Entire Family - Boys, Girls and Grown-Ups, too. A Combination of Strategy and Chance. A board game that kids ages 8 and up will love! They will be asking for more time on this instead of their electronic devices. Fast-Paced, Easy-to-Learn Baseball Action in a fun board game format. Game Includes Playing Pieces, Baseball Diamond Playing Board, Score Sheets and Special Batting and Pitching Dice for Realistic Action.

name.value: Lite'n Up: The Diet Survival Game

item.description: A light-hearted roll and move board game that pits players against the "wheel of willpower." Beware of "Restaurant Row." Comes with a 20 x 20 board, 8 player pieces, 80 tokens, calorie cards, a spinner, 2 dice, and more.
Part of the Stancraft Super Sport series. Comes with 108 plastic coated playing cards, plastic football field, and an instruction book.

Chapayev is a dexterity game originating in the former USSR that is played upon a checkers board. The game is a unique cross between checkers and billiards.

The aim of the game is to advance your row of checkers to the opposite side of the board by winning rounds. Rounds are won by knocking all your opponent's checkers off the board. Within a round, players alternate turns flicking checkers. If you succeed at removing a checker from the opposing team and keep your pieces on the board, you may flick again. When all the opponent's checkers are removed, you win the round and advance your line one row. If you win the round without losing any of your checkers, advance two rows. The army to reach the opposite side of the checkerboard wins!

See also: Chaos Tactics

Bible-themed combination of bingo and trivia. Players draw cards printed with incomplete Bible quotations and must then find the missing portion on their player cards. The first player to completely fill out their card is the winner.

Using three dice (playing die, shooting die, foul shot die) players attempt to pass and score shots as in basketball. Pegs in the small wood board indicate court position. A small plastic container holds the rules, wood board, 3 dice, and 2 pegs.

item.description:
A math card game where the object is to dispose of all the cards in your hand. The first player to do this must shout "Add'Em!" The remaining players must then score the remaining cards in their hands.

The game may be played by up to 4 people with one deck. It can be played by more if further decks are added.

The pack of 52 cards includes 27 number cards, 10 minus number cards, 13 number cards representing totals, 1 "odd" card and 1 "even" card.

Quax is a two player strategy game played on any square board (the author suggests 11x11). A board with Archimedean tiling can also be used.

The goal of Quax is the same as in the famous Hex: to connect the opposite edges of the board with a chain of stones connected to each other.

One of the uncommon features of the game is a special kind of a move: it's possible to connect diagonally adjacent stones of player's color instead of placing a new stone.

item.description:
This is a card game using different breeds of puppies as suits and cats as wild cards. It also includes a spinner with numbers from 1 to 10. The instructions contain rules for 5 different games: 
No More Puppies
Pile of Puppies
Puppy Rummy
Puppy Memory (with a twist)
Plenty of Puppies!

This is a solitaire design based on the early September, 1942 German assault on Kuporosnoye at the far south of Stalingrad. The player controls the German 29th Division, and the game system handles the Russian 35th Guards Division defenders. The game includes 8.5" x 11" cardstock map, set of uncut, color unit counters, and full rules. This game is presented as a simple "standard game" suitable for novices, to which several advanced options can be added. The game stresses "uncertainty" for the solitaire wargamer, which is provided by hidden Russian units, random reinforcements, variable "daily orders" from HQ, and imprecise victory conditions.

Published in Panzer Digest #3.

Worms is a Board Game inspired by the Team17 game of the same name. It brings the strange combination of utter
silliness and tactics from the computer game to the table top.
Worms is game for two to four players and usually on takes about 10 minutes to play. Each player controls one team
of four combat ready Worms. Each worm comes equipped with a variety of weapons from the lowly Pistol to the
awesome and lethal Sheep. (copied from the rulebook)

(Not available online at this time)

item.description:
This card game can be player with a standard deck of cards and was inspired by the hilarious game "Killer Bunnies". If your a fan of the Killer Bunnies game then you will recognize some of the game play mechanics given here. However you will also not fail to notice that it plays significantly differently.

Background Story
In ancient times Noble families fought each other over the diamond mines. They collected diamonds and tried constantly to kill the Nobles of other families. With their competition removed the name and reputation of their own family would rise.

(copied from website)

Game Link: http://www.bookranger.co.uk/CardGames/KillerNobles.htm

Kartazma is a Polish CCG whose topic is the CCG players life. You are controlling a group of characters that are CCG fans. During deck construction you may choose from 3 general types of "heros": Collector ("Kolekcjoner"), Tournament player ("Turniejowiec") and Social guy ("SpoÅ‚ecznik"). There are also cards that represent locations like shops or clubs where you can play, some stuff cards: cell phones, bags, card protectors and finally some quests that you have to accomplish before your opponent does to win the game (like a good trade or wining 3 tournaments).

You will have to construct 3 decks: a main deck ("Talia gÅ‚ówna") with exactly 40 cards, character deck ("Talia Karciarzy") with 10 cards + one main character and quest deck ("Talia wyzwaÅ„") with 5-7 cards. Each of players must also have 3 locations which he will use during that game.

When the Spaniards conquered the Incan Empire, only a few princes managed to flee into the mountains. Well-hidden high above the river Urabumba is a place the Spanish would never discover: The lost city of Machu Picchu. But beware! Is there a traitor among the princes, ready to reveal the location of the secret city to the Spaniards?

Each player represents an Incan prince, whose workers will grow corn, feed llamas, plant coca, and manufacture ceramics and cloth. They try to engage Priests of the Condor, Priests of the Puma, and Virgins of the Sun. The game can end in 2 different ways:

 The Incans win by activating all priests and virgins in time
 The Spaniards win when they discover Machu Picchu




With an Incan victory, the prince who made the wisest sacrifices to the gods will win. With a Spanish victory, the princes who accumulated the most gold will get a multiplier to their score... but it may not be enough to win the game.

Players choose their actions by walking around with their prince on the city map.

This is light game where each player has 8 chips ranging from 1 to 8. There are 3 cups. Each player takes a turn placing this chips in the cups. Whoever wins the most cups wins the round. There a few scoring twists involved.

Get the full game rules from: http://www.gamecabinet.com/rules/TaSe.html

This game is played on chess sized board. Up to 4 players will maneuver around, trying to collect 6 keys E , S , C , A , P , E! to Escape! They will have to dodge the guards or else will get sent back to their cell. On your turn you have 4 moves, in which you can move the guards, the keys and yourself.

Get this game here: http://www.printgames.net/english/detail_e/escape.htm

The "T.B, the Board Game" duplicates all the action of a typical month of talk.bizarre! From the creative postings of most respected oldbie, to the hapless struggling of the most mediocre cavenewt, and yes, even down to the pathetic mewlings of the rankest newbie--you will be there! You will cringe from the heat of the flamewars and the razor sharp wit of the repartee! You will experience the thrill of posting great articles, the shame of posting pathetic articles, and the surge of triumph as you show no mercy, pushing your fellow players over the brink of the volcano... (from the website)

Full Rules from: http://www.gamecabinet.com/rules/TalkBizarre.html

Domination is an abstract strategy game for 2. You will need a chessboard, some checkers and dominoes to play. You pick up the dominoes, place them on the board to restrict movement and then move your piece. If a player is unable to move, that player loses.

name.value: Eagles Across the Sambre: The Waterloo Campaign

item.description:
Napoleon returned to power from Elba to find the Great Powers of Europe united against him. Realizing that he was massively outnumbered, he decided his best chance was to attack first and try to take out some of his adversaries before they could combine and descend on France. He chose to move against the English and the Prussians in Belgium. Furthermore, he thought that he could achieve a political victory if he could capture Brussels. The Waterloo Campaign is a small-scale, fast-play game that simulates the historical events of June, 1815 which ended the career of Napoleon Bonaparte. The goal of the game is to recreate the problems faced by Napoleon at the operational level and perhaps achieve a better result than arguably the greatest general in history.

Game Features

* Small Scale, Quick Play Microgame
 * Only 28 Unit Counters
 * Colorful Game Map 8 1/2 x 11
 * Operational Level Play
 * Four-Page Rules Booklet
 * Game Play Sheet
 * Counter Sheet To Cut Out
 * Solitaire Play Level: HIGH

(from site)
Full Game: http://www.whitedoggames.com/pnpgames.html

Kasvoton vihollinen (Faceless enemy in English) is a game for 2 players. Kasvoton vihollinen is a combat game where two armies fight using cards that were drafted partly at random in the beginning of the game. Cards are placed on the board as initial setup and they can move on the board in a somewhat chess like manner.

Rules contain variants to play the game with 4 players as teams and tournament rules.

name.value: Pickett's Charge: Day Three of Gettysburg
Pickett's Charge: The Third Day of Gettysburg

item.description:
Easily the most famous engagement of the Civil War, Pickett's Charge was the high-water mark of the Confederacy. A frontal attack across open ground by 12,000 - 15,000 men against the center of the Union line in the teeth of withering artillery and small arms fire, Pickett's Charge was the defining moment of the battle of Gettysburg and, although militarily futile, represents to many the courage and glory of the Confederate soldier. Pickets Charge: Day Three of Gettysburg is a small-scale, fast-play simulation of historical events of July 3, 1863.

Game Features

* Small Scale Microgame
 * Only 26 Unit Counters
 * Colorful Game Map 8 1/2 x 11
 * Brigade-Level Tactical Play
 * Five-Page Rules Booklet
 * Game Play Sheet
 * Counter Sheets
 * Quick Play Rules
 * Solitaire Play Level: HIGH

(from site)

Full Game: http://www.whitedoggames.com/pnpgames.html

link.value: Pickett's Charge: The Last Attack at Gettysburg July 3, 1863

name.value: Anzio: The Fight For The Beachhead
Anzio II: The Fight For The Beachhead

item.description:
from site

Anzio: The Fight For The Beachhead is a solitaire or two-player mini-game that simulates at the division level the battle of Anzio. The goal of the Anzio-Nettuno amphibious landings and the resulting so-called battle of Anzio, January - May, 1944, was to outflank the German Winter Line and open the way to Rome. A major battle of World War Two, the initial landings were unopposed. Instead, the resulting fight developed to keep the beachhead.

Third Edition:

Game Features
Solitaire Rules
Off-Map Bombardment
Weather
German Air Attacks
12 Turns
Initiative Checks
ï»¿
Game Components
â€‹17" x 11" Game Board
41 5-8" Mounted, Die-Cut Counters and Markers
8-Page Color Rulebook

Players attempt to accumulate interlocking groups of corporations that feed off one another so as to avoid paying money to anyone else.

It is a roll and move with a twist. When a player lands on his own property, income is collected. When a player lands on another's property that property pays expenses to other industries. Properties can be developed to increase their income and traded among players.

At the end some of the properties are nationalized and players add up their property and cash value. The richest billionaire wins!

item.description: A light counter-based conquer game, Galactic Expansion is a game where each player has a sector map (the basic set comes with 3). Each player's turn is split into 5 phases: Economy (Receive resource for colony), Intel (Espionage, Incite Rebellion, Recon, or Sabotage), Combat (dice-based with modifiers), Deployment, End (Expand or Fortify). The winner is the last person standing.

During his work at the Operations Research Office, the physicist George Gamow invented a simple war game to be played by analysts. The game is played with three identical boards, one for each of the players and one for a referee.
The board … represents a tank battlefield by a lattice of hexagons, … some of which are hatched to represent wooded areas of low visibility. The white hexagons represent open fields, and the size of a hexagon represents the “radius of action” of a tank in battle.
Each player starts with ten markers representing tanks at his back line, and “a move” consists in displacing any number of tanks into any of the adjacent hexagons. Each player sees his board only and must infer from the play where his opponent’s tanks are located.
(from the rules)

Get the full game: ftp://ftp.grognard.com/download/games/board/tankgame.pdf

Kenefick is a non-partnership climbing card game combining various elements from Zheng Fen, Big Two, Poker, and Hearts.

Distinctive features: Deck includes two jokers, which function as wild cards if used in card combinations and the highest card combination if used together. Players score points for going out, and for collecting 10s, Js, Qs, and Ks. Combinations include singles, pairs, two pairs, three of a kinds, straights, flushes, full houses, four of a kinds, straight flushes, and bombs. Play of a trick always starts as a single card, but can always be trumped up to a higher ranked card combination.

item.description: This game consists of 48 cards with questions and answers on them. Start by dealing the cards in equal amounts to all players. The first player starts by asking a question from one of his cards of the player on his left. If that player answers correctly, he gets to take the card and set it aside. If he answers incorrectly, the questioner gets to take a card from that player's hand and set it to his side. If the question is answered incorrectly, the questioner gets to continue to ask other players, until all players have been asked, or the question is answered correctly. If no player gets it, the questioner gets to set that card aside. After all cards are exhausted, the player with the most cards laid aside wins.

Digi-Quate is a game invented by a lecturer from the National University of Singapore. Players draw 10 tokens or tiles with numbers or mathematical operators on them and try to form equations on a square grid playing board. Subsequent play intersects with already played tiles, crossword-style. Covering special squares on the board gives bonus points.

Higher Digi-Quate is an advanced version of Digi-Quate. Like Digi-Quate, it was invented by a National University of Singapore lecturer and it is game of forming mathematical equations on a square grid board. Players have hands of 10 tokens showing numbers and mathematical operators. Each turn they try to form an equation, intersecting crossword-style with equations already on the board. Covering special squares on the board gives bonus points.
The feature that distinguishes Higher Digi-Quate from Digi-Quate is that it adds three dice to the game, a green D10 (numbered 0 to 9) and two red D6s (numbered 0 to 4). The board is larger and there are now bonus squares with pictures of a green D10, a red D6 and two red D6s. Placing an equation that covers these dice bonus squares allows the player to roll the dice and their score may be multiplied; there's also a small risk that the score may be multiplied by zero.

Digi-Quate is a game invented by a lecturer from the National University of Singapore. Players draw 10 tokens or tiles with numbers or mathematical operators on them and try to form equations on a square grid playing board. Subsequent play intersects with already played tiles, crossword-style. Covering special squares on the board gives bonus points.

DotCard is a cardgame played over ten or twenty rounds. Each round is finished when any player is out of cards. The remaining players add the points they have left on the cards left in their hand. The winner is the one who completes all rounds with the lowest score.

The cards in DotCard looks like dominoes and each round starts with different card value, e.g. in round one every player has to start with a card that has nine dots, in round two cards with eight dots and so on.

item.description: Swedish music trivia game. A DVD is included in the game.

This game consists of 44 cards. There are 8 sets of 5 cards each, 2 white rabbit cards, and 2 Cheshire Cat cards. The artwork on these cards is based on the Disney movie. This game has a very "Go Fish" feel to it where players are trying to assemble sets by asking each other for cards. However, players can refuse to give up cards by playing white rabbit cards. Additionally, if a player has asked for a card from a player who does not have it, he can play a Cheshire Cat card for a second chance. The game is played in several rounds until one player reaches 50 points.

An Alice in Wonderland card game with artwork based on Sir John Tenniel's original illustrations for the books.

This game can be played by several people. The 48 cards make up 16 sets of 3 cards each. The cards in each set have different pictures on them, but the same numbers so you know they belong together. The player who assembles the most sets wins.

item.description: This is one of the first card games featuring aviation modes of transport. The deck consists of 67 cards. 46 of them represent types of air transportation (balloon, biplane, etc). the other 21 are "consequence" cards.

Baccardo is an old horse racing card game. It consists of 50 cards and is playable by exactly 4 players. During a game, 1 player is the "bookie" and the others are all "punters."

46 of the cards are horse cards, and the other 4 are one each of "policeman", "welsher", "tipster" and "the odds."

This is a "war" type card game published during the 1950s and 1960s by various publishers. The deck consists of 36 cards with colorful pictures on them. The cards are dealt around evenly to all players. Players do not look at their cards. Play starts with one player turning over his top card, then the next player turns over a card. If a "put" card is turned over, the next player has to turn over a specified number of cards. If no additional "put" card is turned over then the player with the first "put" card wins all face up cards. Eventually, one player will possess all cards and be the winner.

This is a very simple rummy type game for young children.

The deck consists of 44 cards. 14 sets of 3 identical cards each, plus 2 signpost cards to be used as wilds. Deal 6 cards to each player with a draw deck in the middle. Turn over the top card to form the discard pile. Each player's turn consists of drawing 1 card and discarding a card. A player will always have only 6 cards either in hand or in matching sets laid down in front of him. When players have formed sets in their hands by drawing and discarding, they may lay them down face up. The first player to have 2 full sets in front of him is the winner of the hand.

Roma Invicta? is a simulation game about the first two years of Hannibal's campaign in Italy (218-216 BC). The Carthaginians have three armies and the Romans four, the strengths of which are tallied in a chart off the map to save having a lot of counters. These armies are manouvered around the 17 regions of the map of Italy in a simple I go - You go framework, undertaking different actions including ravaging (for the Carthaginians) and combat.

The combat rules are straightforward and simple with a few interesting tweaks such as ambushes. In many cases conflict is restricted to skirmishing between the forces but chance may cause a larger battle to occur. The Romans have to strike a balance between not risking having their armies utterly destroyed in battle by the wily Hannibal whilst not allowing the empire to become demoralised if the Carthaginians are allowed to ravage the land unimpeded.

The game, given to Society of Ancients members as part of their subscription in 2008, consists of a 20 page A4 rule-book with colour covers, a simple but adequate map and 36 counters which you need to cut out yourself.

item.description:
There are 56 cards in the deck, and the theme is that of trading world currency. The number of cards used to play varies with the number of players. Game requires at least 3 but may be played with up to 7. The cards include 48 "Capital" cards. 8 each from London, New York, Montreal, Paris, Brussels and Berlin. There are also 7 "rise and fall" cards and 1 "sell" card.

The goal of the game is to make a profit at the "Close of the Market" on whatever currency they hold, which is represented by the "Capital" cards in their hand.

This game is played with a pack of 53 cards and is based on the nursery rhyme "Sing a Song of Sixpence." The colorful cards feature the different characters from the rhyme. This is a war-like game where cards are dealt face down to players and they turn cards up one at a time, battling to steal each others cards until finally one player holds all. Special cards like clowns, queens, kings, and maids dictate how many cards must be turned up.

A card game dedicated to Princess Alexandria of Denmark, who married Edward VII of Wales in 1863 at Windsor. The game consists of 48 cards with color pictures of wildflowers. It looks like a set collecting card game.

The deck consists of 44 cards. There are 8 sets of 5 bird cards, and 4 owl cards. Each of the 8 sets have a letter on them, then each of the birds within the set are numbered 1 through 5. The object of the game is to collect as many sets of 5 with the same letter on them as you can. The game proceeds with players asking for cards from each other and assembling sets. If you have a card but don't want to give it up, you may play an owl card. As soon as you have a set of 5, lay it down in front of you. When all sets have been assembled the game is over.

The deck consists of 44 cards depicting full color artwork of attractions and towns in mainland Britain. The game was published around 1960.

This is a set collecting game that has two different variations of play depending on how many players there are. There is one variation for 2 players, and another for 3 to 6 players.

item.description:
The object of this game is to dispose of all of your cards in sets and score the highest number of points while doing so. This game was published in 1954 and was based on the Disney movie. The deck consists of 12 sets of 3 identical cards each, 6 "Final Cards", and 2 "Prize Cards".

The game rules vary slightly depending on how many are playing.

Author's Description:

Version 1.1 of the Wildfire rules system, a generic rule set for 15mm science fiction skirmishes (the rules are easily adapted for other scales). Employing a simple and intuitive yet tactical counters-based system with full rules for infantry and vehicles, Wildfire includes a complete design system to let you create forces from your imagination or based on a film or book. An optional background, the Second Sphere, is also included. One hundred and five pages of science fiction action!

Expanded by:

 Wildfire Overkill

From the box:

A golf game on the 19th hole for golf widows, hackers, and experts.

The game comes with 4 pawns, 8 stroke counters, 64 cards, and 5 different hole layouts.

name.value: Jenga: New York Yankees Collector's Edition

item.description:
Take the Yankees to the top!

Play Jenga a fun new way – with New York Yankees blocks and die! It’s the same great Jenga with a baseball twist. Build your tower with Yankees blue and gray blocks. As the tower builds so does the difficulty. Custom Yankees Jenga rules throw each player a curve ball making the game even more fun – and more challenging! Game comes complete with 54 Yankees hard wood Jenga blocks, 1 custom die, custom Yankees Jenga baseball rules and a loading tray for assembly.

A quick playing game of wits for 2 players.

The K'uhul is a sacred ring of standing stone statues, once erected to appease the bloodthirsty god, Coatlicue. Although many mysteries surround K'uhul, it has remained fairly harmless over the past 1000 years.

Now two rival shamans have arrived to worship at the sacred site and discover that they are in violent disagreement over the origins and purpose of K'uhul. The only thing they agree on is that K'uhul is a gate to untold power.

As their increasingly heated arguments begin to disrupt the local village--the village Head Man decides to end the bickering by holding a contest: the first shaman to be able to successfully activate the power of K'uhul will win the respect and riches of the village, while the loser will be sacrificed to appease Coatlicue--who is no doubt annoyed by the constant bickering.

The contest is held on a 3x3 grid within the ring of sacred statues. The ring of statues is formed by making piles of "gate chips" which surround 9 single chips which form the gate itself. The gate chips come in two styles, Runes and Stars, and the 3x3 pattern they form must be manipulated to match that of one of the special "gate cards". By arranging the chips to match the pattern of a gate card, a shaman can "unlock" the gate.

Gameplay is further complicated by the presence of several types of "special" chips as well as "spell" cards that are activated when a gate card is "unlocked".

The first player to successfully "unlock" two of the face-up gate cards PLUS a final gate card from their own hand, will be declared the winner. The loser is then sacrificed during the ensuing celebration to the merriment of all.

A trivia game based solely on news and articles from the glamor magazine Séð & heyrt (an Icelandic version of the Danish magazine Se & Hør). There are 2100 questions about the famous, various happenings and glamor stories. Play can be for 2-6 people or for teams with 1-6 players.

item.description: A game of adventure, based on the Icelandic movie Astrópía. 2 to 6 players compete in this game to find a necklace of power and bring it back to Dagur. The characters can use various rpg-based items to aid them in this quest.

A simple educational game about Icelandic birds. The game comes with a CD with the calls of 30 birds. Rules for three kinds of games are included, Sound Bingo, Photo Bingo and Memory. The bingo cards have photos of 9 birds each and the players either listen to bird calls or are shown photos of a bird and try to get a bingo. Memory is simply a memory game with photos of birds.

This game is based on an international Rally competition held in Iceland for a few years, called the Ljómarally. A simple roll and move game where you try compete in the Ljómarally both on special (closed) routes and ferry (open) routes. Players can both compete in stand-alone rallies or a summer long championship.

Preums! is a free card game for 3-6 players. Everyone plays as a blogger, trying to build the more valuable blog in order to sell it. The game is quick and fast : most actions are played simultaneously. The card are drawn by webcomics artists, the game is available or free on the Internet.

Aim of the game

You have to meet around your blog the most valuable visitors. After that you can raise founds. Be the first one to have a "six zero worth" weblog.

Home Page: http://preums.webcomics.fr/page/sets-de-cartes-premi%C3%A8re-fourn%C3%A9e

item.description:
Come on, let's go to school! How exciting the everyday life of a school kid can be. Only the one who gets up promptly and is punctual at the bus stop will get to school on time. There the hurly-burley continues. With all the other children and the interesting things to learn, the day passes in a flash.

While playing, the children will learn how their day will change when they start going to school. Further on, memory and first handling of the clock are trained in a playful way. The instructions contain several variants including one for cooperative play. all of differing degrees of difficulty.

Which players will be paired off as the most "date-able" couples? You'll find out in this unique home adaptation of television's popular game show of dates and mates!

First players secretly write down their answers to questions, and then they vote on the ones they liked best. When all the votes are tallied, players are revealed to each other and the matchmaking begins!

There's No Place Like Rome ...and Onieda County

(c)1982 CPM

This is a monopoly-style game about Rome, New York and the surrounding region. It was produced by the City of Rome and the Rome Area Chamber Of Commerce.

Includes a colorful game board featuring local tourist attractions, 4 tokens, red plastic chips, play money, 2 dice, rules, business cards, deed cards, and a storage insert.

name.value: Small Commercial Real Estate Lending Game

item.description: The object of the game is to become the wealthiest mortgage broker through commissions earned by closing loans on the properties shown on the game board. This game was created by Interbay Funding to expand the knowledge of mortgage brokers and others who originate loans for small businesses.

link.value: Late for the Sky Production Company

item.description: Take2 "The fast thinking word game" comes with instructions and 120 letter tiles. Each player starts with 8 tiles and uses them to make words in crossword/scrabble style in front of themselves. When one player has used all their tiles they call "Take2" and all players draw 2 more tiles to add to their stock. Words can be rearranged at any time and play continues until all tiles are in the players hands and one has used all their tiles. At that time points on tiles not in use count against those players. Several rounds can be played, adding the scores and the lowest scoring player winning after the agreed number of rounds.

name.value: The Inmost Sea: The Battle of Lepanto 1571

item.description:
“…for the inmost sea of all the earth is shaken with his ships.
They have dared the white republics up the capes of Italy,
They have dashed the Adriatic round the Lion of the Sea,
And the Pope has cast his arms abroad for agony and loss,
And called the kings of Christendom for swords about the Cross…”
 from Lepanto
 by G.K. Chesterton

1571. Suleiman the Magnificent, the law-giver, is dead.

With Cyprus falling to the Turks, Pope Pius V calls the squadrons of Europe together to stop the Ottoman advance. Given the command is the 24-year old Don Juan d'Austria, bastard son of the Holy Roman Emperor. By the end of a fateful October afternoon, the Catholics will have won an inestimable moral victory and Suleiman's son Selim would have to drain his empire’s coffers to rebuild his shattered fleet from scratch.

Thanks to remarkable surviving records of the order of battle, The Inmost Sea simulates this epic clash at the individual ship level. Ostensibly a two-player game, also playable with fog-of-war solitaire rules, or as multiple independent wing commands with three players to a side. Play any of the three wings in separate scenarios, or the entire grand battle. Also includes several alternate history setups.

Game & graphic design by Mark Mahaffey
Cover painting by Radoslav Javor
Leader portraits by Leona Preston

item.description:
From the box:
"An amusing, competitive game for all the family. A new game based on a familiar idea.

"Have a lot of laughs! A competitive game focusing on 3 key figures to be completed for bonus points, while each player assembles as many sets as possible.

"The game includes:
- 27 Head cards
- 27 Torso cards
- 27 Foot cards
- A poster containing 27 full color reproductions presenting the complete works of art and their creators.
- Instruction sheet with rules of the game."

About the game:
Players try to assemble complete figures based on famous works of art by making sets of heads, torsos and legs/feet. Bonus points are given to the player who can completely assemble the three figures in the middle of the table.

Shock Army was the name given to the elite fighting units of the Republican 'Ejercito Popular' (The Popular Army). The game recreates a number of attacks by these spearhead corps.

Shock Army is designed to be played as a table top game between two players. No map is included, but there are sufficient terrain features to fight four major scenarios.

The game is built around three fundamental concepts. The first is the importance in battle of an army's command system, that is the way in which its headquarters is organized. Orders from HQ's are represented by impulse counters.

The second fundamental concept is that of "fighting power". Each unit has a total fighting power factor. In combat opposing forces compare their total fighting power factors - the unit with the higher fighting power factor is the victor.

Thirdly, every combat unit can move an unlimited distance. However, the further a unit moves in one go, the lower its fighting power will fall. This represents the breakdown of cohesion in a unit if it is pushed too far, too quickly.

Sports lottery using the traditional betting system of the Spanish football league. Can be played alone or between several players. A wheel is used to obtain the results. A familiar game from the 50's in Spain.

name.value: Olive Oyl I'll Catch my Popeye

item.description: Actually this is a SPIN & MOVE game from Hasbro dated 1956. The game comes with a large Spinner that has numbers from 0 to 4 which determines your movement. The game also has a board with around 50 spaces of differing colors which allow Olive, equipped with her trusty rolling pin to attempt to catch Popeye. The game comes with two playing pieces, one for Olive and one for Popeye.

Roll to move your shuttles through four ALERT levels on your way to achieving PEACE. Use missiles and peace pawns to protect your shuttles from opponents as you move forward, engaging in the power struggle that comes with a quest for peace.

From the manufacturer: Naked! has the same values and suits as a regular poker deck, but printed on each card is an article of clothing. Play your favorite poker games. When you win, you get to assign cards from your winning hand to other players. Players who receive cards have to remove the clothing that is pictured on the card. The winner is the last player remaining who is not Naked!

From the manufacturer:

Anything you can do, I can do BETTER! Chalenj! Is the all thinking, all action activity game that brings out the competitive side in everyone!! Can you name more US States than your sister? Can you beat your best friend at singing Madonna songs? Find out by racing around the Chalenj! board, chalenjing each other to be the best in four separate categories. If one player decides to Chalenj another, the glove is slapped down on the table and the fun begins. Ages 8 and up. For 2 to 6 players or teams.

item.description:
From the manufacturer:

Link-O is the fun, challenging numbers game that will have you turning in circles! Place tiles end to end on the board by matching the numbers and color on each tile, as you try to be the first to play all of your tiles. The tiles left over in your opponent's possession are totaled as points for YOU. It's all-around fun with numbers for the whole family! Includes 64 tiles, tile bag, game board and instructions in English and Spanish. For 2 to 6 Players. Ages 5 and up.

A 2 to 4 player racing game Ages 5 and up. Race to be the first player to get all four of your movers to the finish. Comes with a colorful plastic game board with a dice popper in the center, and 16 movers.

name.value: Ben 10 Omnitrix Duel for Power Game

item.description:
From the manufacturer:

Go head to head against your opponent as you try to collect the most alien cards and win. The Omnitrix tells you whether you want to have the lower or the higher card during each battle. Achieve that and you add both cards to your win pile. Special cards tie the battle up and bring another, more powerful battle on!

name.value: Suite Life Double the Fun Card Game

item.description: Turn up cards for points until you decide to stop and you keep your points for that turn. If you keep going, you wager the amount of points you have accumulated and push your luck to gain more with each card you turn up. If you turn up a Moseby, you lose all the points you gained for that turn, UNLESS you get a Joker Zack, which makes you immune to Moseby. Collect pairs of Zack and Cody cards for extra points. The player with the most points when the cards run out is the winner.

Contents: 4 double-sided playing pieces, 4 6-piece sturdy cardboard puzzles, a bell (ála Halli Galli), gaming board, a die.

Each player represents a pair of Moomin characters. Players are trying to build a boat by collecting 6 pieces of their puzzle. Each player starts from their own corner of the board. During your turn you roll a six-sided die and move your gaming piece clockwise around the gameboard. 1st player to collect all six pieces and get back to their starting corner sails to the lighthouse island for search of a hidden treasure.

Players get pieces for their puzzles during their own turn when they pass their starting corner or when they hit a location depicting a happy sun on the board and their gaming piece also shows a happy sun. When player hits a location that shows different sun than their gaming piece at the moment, their piece is flipped over (happy/sad).

It is possible to get a piece of the puzzle during someone elses turn: The die has numbers from 1 to 5. One side has a picture of "Haisuli" eg. Stinky. Whenever this side comes up, whoever is first to hit the bell in the middle of the board (at the lighthouse island) grabs a extra piece for their puzzle.

Also, it is possible to lose already collected puzzle pieces when you hit a sad sun and your gaming piece also shows a sad sun or when you hit another players starting corner.

Game of The Year 2007 Childrens Game finalist in Finland.

item.description: A Scrabble-like word game designed and published by an advertising agency for using as a gift to their customers. You are using nine letters, there are no tripling options, doubling options are scarce and there are some extra bonuses available. The rules are constantly making fun of the advertisement world.

Hells Foxes is a board game of the North African Campaign of World War II conducted between the Axis forces of Germany and Italy and the Allied forces of United Kingdom - England, Australia, New Zealand, India, South Africa, France, Poland, Jewish Battalion, from the Spring of 1941 until the winter of 1942.
 COMPONENTS


 1 "Rules Book" consisting with a Light BLUE 'cover' which contains some "Errata", and inside 16 pages of "Rules", while the BACK 'cover' has some "Charts" and other *Notes*.
 4 Paper MAPS 11 X 16 Black on White printed with "Graphic" renditions displaying the "Terrain" from its 'genre' for "WW-2 North Africa Campaigns" at the time of publication. Adjoin these in correct 'order' from 1 to 4 and secure properly, such as with taping it down, or placing "perspex" / "plexiglas" for that. 
 3 Small Label Sheets with Front & Back images comprising:
 (1) of RED print for "Axis"
 (1) of BLUE print for "Allied"
 (1) of GREEN print for BOTH to use as "Game Markers".

A spin and move board game for Ages 7 - 12. Comes with cardboard cutout players, spinner, board, and rules. Based on the Hanna-Barbera cartoon series of the same name. The object of the game is to help the Butler family make it safely across the valley to the caves.

In this children's game, the players must reach the treasure by throwing the dice and moving on the board. During journey they will find dangers such as the giant octopus, the dungeon of doom, the infected rats and the great volcano. They should avoid these risks to get the treasure trove and win.
